page.title: 19RELIGION SAUNDERSFOOT
page.content: There are five places of worship in Saundersfoot.The oldest is{St.Issells {Church}a Norman building situated just outside the village.It was built there to escape pirate raids.St Issells was a local saint who lived in the C6th.He was the father of St.Teilo who had connections with Tenby.The oldest part is the C13th tower,the Norman Chancel Arch and the C15th font.There is also a preaching cross dating from the C15th.The present vicar is the Rev. Micheal Butler who took over in 1980. There is a regular congregation of about 200.There are three Chapels in the village.One is the{Methodist Ch on the Ridgeway,built in 1982. There is a regular Sunday School at 11.00am and a Siterhood meeting at Wed 2.30pm There is a stained glass window which was given to the chapel in memory of Ann Hitchings who died 12/11/11 age 85
